question.body: Which molecule in the sarcomere uses ATP to generate force?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Actin is the protein being pulled, but does not use ATP directly.
Correct. Myosin needs ATP to release from the actin filament and move the lever arm for a new power-stroke.
Incorrect. Troponin helps in the actin-myosin interaction, but it does not generate force.
Incorrect. Acetylcholine transmits signals from neurons to the muscle fiber.
